name: TheAtlantic
text: "Vaccines are not an off switch. It will take several months to vaccinate enough Americans to resume normal life, and this interim could prove long, confusing, and chaotic," writes @sarahzhang: https://t.co/QkgqdA56Ph

name: TheAtlantic
text: ‚ÄúWe carry a million stories within us at any given time, and depending what they are, they can help us, lead us astray, or get us through the day.‚Äù @tepingchen talks with Oliver Munday about writing characters who are full of longing: https://t.co/Mqe76cotQT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Millions of people have lost friends to COVID-19. For "The Friendship Files," @julieebeck talks with one of them, Mary-Ann, who shares what made her friend Baby so special and reflects on the struggle of mourning a personal loss during a global crisis. https://t.co/SfBCB0uJuV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Voter anxiety about election security is being stoked in states that have behaved responsibly, while states that have been less responsive to expert advice get a free pass," @normative writes: https://t.co/Y6WB12op9c

name: TheAtlantic
text: The historical record tends to overlook the simple moments of pleasure and joy in the lives of African Americans, @reetamac writes. But the artist Terry Adkins brings them to the forefront in these images: https://t.co/VQZk4UwjVV

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: The worst week of the pandemic brought the best news so far: The vaccine is here. All that‚Äôs left to do is wait. https://t.co/LCA7bd0eth

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Though deploying a COVID-19 vaccine successfully will not be easy, the history of public health suggests that it is possible. Reductions in vaccine-preventable disease are one of the great achievements in human history," @BrendanNyhan writes: https://t.co/PjKfXdufGB

name: TheAtlantic
text: "With the closures of sports stadiums, concert halls, and movie theaters, the only stage fit for the pandemic turned out to be the small screen." @shirklesxp, @megangarber, and Hannah Giorgis on the best TV shows of 2020: https://t.co/aLpDhLOREM

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Plenty of work remains to be done to ensure the integrity of our democratic process, but ignorant and spurious conspiracy theories, advanced by partisan hacks shamelessly posing as newly minted champions of electoral cybersecurity, hamper...that effort."
https://t.co/gXi7o7c72G

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @beccarosen: "Science-focused corrections of vaccine misinformation are typically less effective than other messages‚Äîfor example, focusing on the risks of the diseases that vaccines protect against." https://t.co/GU95A1fVMV

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Day 12 of the 2020 Hubble Space Telescope Advent Calendar: The Cosmic Reef. This giant red nebula (NGC 2014) and its smaller blue neighbor (NGC 2020) are part of a vast star-forming region in the Large Magellanic Cloud, located 163,000 light-years away. https://t.co/oVvhgBoeYW https://t.co/69qzkQsCwS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As cases spike and a vaccine rollout appears imminent, [the infectious-disease expert ] Dr. Lisa is worried. In her estimation, public-health officials are failing to reach the general public because they don‚Äôt use accessible language," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/WL2aNWl0cf

name: TheAtlantic
text: Blue tigers that once roamed China may not have gone extinct because of some genetic flaw, but because of sheer bad luck, writes @NerdyChristie. https://t.co/dm7k77QJTM

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Time has announced its shortlist for Person of the Year.

While the feature is a smart idea, there‚Äôs no excuse for the media pretending it‚Äôs news and turning themselves into free PR for Time Inc. @GrahamDavidA on why we should ignore it (from 2012): https://t.co/adMaZLOZ9Y

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Apparently, Obama‚Äôs remarks on Snapchat had revealed his indifference to police killings and racist policies, his callousness toward grieving families, and his unwillingness to believe the testimony of the bereaved," @CaitlinPacific writes: https://t.co/vmdNmh7dGg
